short_description: dylan investments is a venture capital & investment firm based in los angeles, california, united states.
long_description: founded in 1990, damavandi capital is a real estate investment firm that focuses on the restoration, renovation and repositioning of distressed commercial and residential properties throughout the united states and internationally. damavandi capital focuses on creating intrinsic value for all parties in a transaction, including investors, business districts and communities. our mantra for the last 20 years has been to find the best mismatches between price and value and use this imbalance to return profit to our investors. damavandi capital has acquired, invested and managed over $2 billion in real estate assets, achieving average portfolio returns of about 40% to its investors. operating out of a single los angeles-based office, the company's consolidated and interconnected operations give timely, professional, and superlative responsiveness, expediting investment goals and quality of life improvement in its investments. the company's unique background and ability to qualitatively and quantitatively value distressed assets delivers value and profit to investors.
generated_description: dylan investments is a real estate investment firm based in west hollywood, california. founded in 1990, the company specializes in the restoration, renovation, and repositioning of distressed commercial and residential properties both in the united states and internationally. dylan investments focuses on creating value for all parties involved in a transaction, including investors, business districts, and communities. the firm has acquired, invested in, and managed over $2 billion in real estate assets, achieving average portfolio returns of approximately 40% for its investors. dylan investments offers services such as valuation, purchase and possession, project team implementation, capital improvements, renovation, leasing, reporting, and exit strategies. the company also specializes in bond financing, tax credit allocation, and the acquisition of profitable real estate through fannie mae and auctions, as well as short sales and real estate owned (reo) property acquisitions.
